text:
Hi everyone,
 I'm working on setting up an M2M (machine-to-machine) token for interacting with the Daml ledger. So far, using this token I'm able to *allocate a party* and *get the ledger end* successfully. However, when I try to *create a contract*, the request fails with a `PERMISSION_DENIED` error.
I suspect this might be related to the token's permissions — perhaps I'm missing the `actAs` or `readAs` claims. Here's what the token fields in payload currently look like:
```{
  "iss": "",
  "sub": "",
  "aud": "",
  "iat": 1751963894,
  "exp": 1752050294,
  "scope": "",
  "gty": "",
  "azp": ""
}```
Has anyone encountered this issue before or knows which claims are required in the token for contract creation to succeed?
Any help would be appreciated!

elements.text:

 I'm working on setting up an M2M (machine-to-machine) token for interacting with the Daml ledger. So far, using this token I'm able to
allocate a party
and
get the ledger end
successfully. However, when I try to
create a contract
, the request fails with a
PERMISSION_DENIED

error.
I suspect this might be related to the token's permissions — perhaps I'm missing the
actAs
or
readAs
claims. Here's what the token fields in payload currently look like:

Has anyone encountered this issue before or knows which claims are required in the token for contract creation to succeed?
Any help would be appreciated!

text:
<@U0PQ8E25D> it seems that the canton coin instrument admin has been updated, originally I was getting this value on devnet: `DSO::122071b3b1bdf69f2df3e161bd9933f2c419cdac3c48eaab7c2b920b6956d5d2a87b`

now I am getting `DSO::1220be58c29e65de40bf273be1dc2b266d43a9a002ea5b18955aeef7aac881bb471a`

Is it expected to change often? I feel it is going to be hard to maintain mapping if the token contract get updated frequently?

text:
Hello!

After the mainnet migration was done for our validator (IEU) it appears that I’m no longer receiving the transactions from before when using `getTransactionTrees` (Java API).

I do get some transactions with earlier timestamps and they all have `workflowId = canton-network-acs-import-X-Y` , but I’m not getting the real transaction history that was there before the migration.

Any tips on what might be going wrong?

elements.text:
Hello!

After the mainnet migration was done for our validator (IEU) it appears that I’m no longer receiving the transactions from before when using
getTransactionTrees

(Java API).

I do get some transactions with earlier timestamps and they all have
workflowId = canton-network-acs-import-X-Y

, but I’m not getting the real transaction history that was there before the migration.

Any tips on what might be going wrong?
